This vignette describes the background and application of the functions of the package "TropFishR".
The package TropFishR is a compilation of fish stock assessment methods and models listed in the FAO Technical Manual "Introduction into tropical fish stock assessment" by Sparre and Venema (1998) and exercise book (Sparre & Venema 1999).



## Contents

1. Estimation of growth parameters

    * `Bhattacharya.R`
    
    * `ELEFAN.R`

1. Estimation of mortality rates

    * `Z_CPUE.R`
   
    * `CatchCurve.R`
   
    * `Z_BevertonHolt.R`
   
    * `M_Pauly.R`
   
    * `M_RikhterEfanov.R`
   
1. Virtual population methods

    * `VPA.R`

1. Gear selectivity

    * `select.R`
    
    * `select_ogive.R`
    
    * `rtypes_Millar.R`
    
    * `select_Millar.R`

1. Prediction models

    * `Predict_BevertonHolt.R`

    * `Predict_ThompsonBell1.R`
    
    * `Predict_ThompsonBell2.R`
    
    * `Predict_ThompsonBell_Fleets.R`
    
    * `Predict_ThompsonBell_FM_Lc.R`

1. Estimation of maximum sustainable yield using surplus production models

    * `prod_mod.R`
    
    * `prod_mod_dyn.R`




## 1. Estimation of growth parameters (Chapter 3)

### Bhattacharya method

Bhattacharya method to distinguish and seperate cohorts from a length-frequency distribution. Refers to Chapter 3.4

### ELEFAN

Electronic LEngth Frequency ANalysis to estimate growth parameters from length-frequency data. Refers to chapter 3.5.1.

## 6. Estimation of maximum sustainable yield using surplus production models (Chapter 9)

### Equilibrium production models

Chapter 9.1

Schaefer model assuming Bmsy  = K/2 

Fox model assuming Bmsy = 0.37*K

### Non-equilibrium production models

Not included in the manual by Sparre and Venema (1998).
code adopted from Dharmendra and Sólmundsson (2005), more theory in Hilborn and Walters (1992).



## References

Dharmendra, D., Sólmundsson, J., 2005. Stock assessment of the offshore Mauritian banks
using dynamic biomass models and analysis of length frequency of the Sky Emperor
(\emph{Lethrinus mahsena}). Fisheries Training Program The United Nations University, 61

Hilborn, R. and Walters, C., 1992. Quantitative Fisheries Stock Assessment: Choice,
Dynamics and Uncertainty. Chapman and Hall, New York

Millar, R. B., Holst, R., 1997. Estimation of gillnet and hook selectivity
using log-linear models. ICES Journal of Marine Science: Journal du Conseil,
54(3):471-477

Sparre, P., Venema, S.C., 1998. Introduction to tropical fish stock assessment. Part 1. Manual. \emph{FAO Fisheries Technical Paper}, (306.1, Rev. 2): 407 

Sparre, P., Venema, S.C., 1999. Introduction to tropical fish stock assessment. Part 2. Excercises. \emph{FAO Fisheries Technical Paper}, (306.2, Rev. 2). 94 p.












## Figures

The figure sizes have been customised so that you can easily put two images side-by-side. 

```{r, fig.show='hold'}
plot(1:10)
plot(10:1)
```

You can enable figure captions by `fig_caption: yes` in YAML:

    output:
      rmarkdown::html_vignette:
        fig_caption: yes

Then you can use the chunk option `fig.cap = "Your figure caption."` in **knitr**.
